title: Justin Bieber tells Peta to 'suck it' over debate around his new pets
text:
Justin has been showing off his pet cats on Instagram as of late (Picture: Getty Images/Instagram)

Justin Bieber has hit back at Peta after the animal rights organisation previously criticised his choice to buy two exotic cats to keep as pets.

The singer was said to have reportedly spent around $35,000 (£28,000) on two wild Savannah cats, which he named Sushi and Tuna.

Justin, who got married to Hailey Baldwin earlier in the week, has proudly showed off his new pets on Instagram, even giving the furry felines their own page, with the username ‘@kittysushiandtuna’.

However, Peta slammed the popstar, criticising him for buying the pets and not adopting from shelters.

‘When millions of animals are losing their lives every year because not enough people adopt – choosing instead to shop – the animal overpopulation crisis is a “real problem,”’ Peta president Ingrid Newkirk said in a statement.

Now, Justin has responded to Peta’s claims, telling the group that they can ‘suck it’, as he stresses they should ‘focus on real problems’.

‘Ur tripping because I want a specific kind of cat?’ he wrote in a statement on Instagram stories.

‘U weren’t tripping when I got my dog Oscar and he wasn’t a rescue… every pet we get must be a rescue?

‘I believe in adopting rescues but also think there are preferences and that’s what breeders are for.’

He added: ‘Peta, go help with all of the plastic in the ocean, and leave my beautiful cats alone (sic).’

Justin has told Peta to ‘focus on real problems’ (Picture: Instagram)

He later added that he wants the group to ‘leave his beautiful cats alone’ (Picture: Instagram)

The Savannah cat is a cross between a several, a form of wild cat, and a domestic cat.

Savannah cats are legally restricted or banned in a number of US states but are allowed to be kept as pets in Illinois, Tennessee, South Carolina and California, according to the Savannah Cat Association.

This isn’t the first time that Justin has been under fire for his treatment of pet animals.

He notably abandoned a pet monkey which was seized by German authorities in 2013 after attempting to take it into the country without relevant paperwork, while in 2017, he gave his seven-month-old Chow Chow dog away to one of his dancers as he was reportedly ‘too busy’ to look after it, according to TMZ.
